abstract: A federal appeals court threw out an $800 billion class-action lawsuit on behalf of smokers of light cigarettes who said they were misled.
snippet: A federal appeals court threw out an $800 billion class-action lawsuit on behalf of smokers of light cigarettes who said they were misled.
lead_paragraph: In a legal victory for the tobacco industry, a federal appeals court on Thursday threw out an $800 billion class-action lawsuit on behalf of smokers who said they were misled that light cigarettes were safer than regular ones.

headline.main: Suit on Light Cigarettes Is Thrown Out
